main event: An object fell on the ground in Jackson, Michigan, burning a hole in the pavement and glowing without a flame for about three minutes.
interesting points: The object was identified as being from a flare after residue analysis., The incident caused a local sensation, as reported by the Jackson Citizen Patriot., Witness Mrs. Lewis Westcott pointed to the burned pavement where the object fell., The object emitted a faint smell of phosphorus., The case was closed after logical leads were developed by the investigation.
witness description: Mrs. Lewis Westcott pointed to the burnt area.
